title: Black's picturesque tourist of Scotland.
snippet: The road from Kinross to Perth, (which is 17 miles distant), passes the village of Milnathort, and the ruins of Burleigh Castle, formerly the property of Lord Burleigh, attainted in 171.5.

title: Four years in Great Britain.
author: Colton, Calvin
snippet: The coach from Stirling to Perth, by the way of Dollar and Milnathort, passes in full view of Loch Leven, that placid sheet of water, in the midst of which are the island and ruins of the castle where Queen Mary was incarcerated,  and from which she made her escape with Douglass, May 2d, 1568.

title: Provost-Marshal: a romance of the middle shires
author: Moncreiff, Frederick Charles
snippet: His query as to the Standing Stone wasmeant to draw an answer which would show whetherthe lad came by Milnathort or from the south.

title: Provost-Marshal: a romance of the middle shires
author: Moncreiff, Frederick Charles
snippet: On the higher ground to the north a few houseshave straggled some way towards Milnathort; whileto the south the drainage effected sixty years ago hasdrawn the waters of Lochleven from the immediatevicinity of the town.
